job_title: Analog and Mixed Signal Design Engineer
job_Description: Analog/Mixed Signal IC Design Engineer      This position is part of a highly skilled multi-geographical team tasked with the development of high speed analog, mixed signal, and custom digital 5nm and 3nm CMOS circuits that comprise our leading-edge high speed interfaces such as HBM and UCIe, PLLs, and general mixed signal IP such as ADCs and DACs. This key differentiating IP is used in the Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, HPC and Hyper-Scale Data Center markets. Commitment to team success, customer satisfaction, first time right quality, and ease of use is critical.        Responsibilities:    Design, prelayout, and postlayout verification of circuits to be used as part of state-of-the-art integrated circuits including:      PLLs, Phase Interpolators      High speed clock distribution networks      High Speed DACs and ADCs      Rx Decision-Feedback Equalizers and deserializers      TX drivers and serializers      This role involves      Developing circuit schematics, performing detailed layout reviews and performing all necessary verification/simulations.      Optimizing circuits in high speed paths for low jitter and low power.      Conducting design reviews and creating slides and other associated documentation.      Assisting with integration into SOCs      Providing guidance to validation engineers in initial bring-up, debug, and characterization        Knowledge and Experience:    The position requires extensive experience with designing high-speed custom analog and digital circuits for SerDes IP.      The candidate should be extremely familiar with the use of the Cadence Virtuoso tool suite to design and verify high-speed custom circuits, including      Virtuoso schematic capture and layout      Spectre circuit simulator      Virtuoso Analog Design Environment (ADE) – Explorer, Assembler, etc.      Design experience in advanced CMOS nodes is required; FinFET design experience is a plus.      The ideal candidate will have wide-ranging experience, with a demonstrated ability to rely on both thorough understanding of engineering fundamentals and design creativity to solve circuit design problems.      The ideal candidate will also have a demonstrated ability to clearly present their work to other circuit designers and to non-experts as well.        Education:    Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering and 12+ years of related experience      Master’s degree and 10+ years of related experience, or PhD and 7+ years of related experience        Additional Job Description:    Compensation and Benefits      The base salary range for this position is $102,000 - $170,000 annually.      This position is also eligible for a discretionary annual bonus in accordance with the relevant plan documents and equity in accordance with equity award agreements.      Broadcom offers a competitive and comprehensive benefits package including but not limited to the following: Medical, dental and vision plans, 401(K) participation including company matching, Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP), Employee Assistance Program (EAP), company paid holidays, paid sick leave and vacation time. The company follows all national and state requirements for Paid Family Leave and other leaves of absence.      The foregoing information is provided in compliance with the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act and is the company's good faith and reasonable estimate of the compensation range and benefits offered for this position. The compensation offered to the successful applicant may vary based on factors including experience, skills, education, location, and other job-related reasons.      Broadcom is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We will consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability status, medical condition, pregnancy, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. We will also consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records consistent with local law.      If you are located outside USA, please be sure to fill out a home address as this will be used for future correspondence.

Ready to join a growing company in an expanding industry?  Ready for a change in your career that has impact?  La Jolla Logic is looking for a  Full Stack Developer in Colorado Springs, CO.  The Space Systems Command (SSC) is designated as the responsible office to provide enterprise level Defensive Cyber Operations capability to the Space Enterprise. To accomplish the unique mission, SSC created four agile product lines to rapidly field operational prototypes that will deliver space enterprise protection and threat detection, identification and response capabilities, develop cyber solutions for Enterprise Ground System (EGS), provide advanced enterprise cyberspace solutions to new and legacy missions today, and support legacy mission transition to EGS. The scope of this work effort includes support to deliver incremental new functionality for the Defensive Cyber Operations for Space (DCO-S) Protect product line based in Colorado Springs, Colorado. The Protect product line provides appropriate capabilities to enable delivery of critical infrastructure services and supports the ability to limit or contain the impact of a potential cybersecurity event. The capabilities within this product line include: identity management and access control, user training, data protection, and implementing protection processes. The support will also include prototyping of the DCO-S Protect product line to help revolutionize the way the United States Space Force builds, deploys, and operates software to overcome the challenges of the next space conflict.  Responsibilities:  Competencies/Knowledge Bases: scrum, Kanban, extreme programming, artificial intelligence (AI), intelligent agents, pattern recognition, agent learning, machine learning (ML), modern UI/UX design, software architecture, website development, object-oriented design, distributed systems, cloud-native design (required), web services (required)  Applications/Frameworks: Kibana, ElasicSearch Web Services, Elastic Stack (ELK), React.js, React Native, Material UI, Git, GitHub, bash, Subversion, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Microsoft SQL Server, SQLite, phpMyAdmin, Eclipse, Visual Studio, Mongo, JSON, Amazon RDS, Amazon S3, Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL)  Training: ElasticSearch engineer, leading SAFe, SAFe for teams  Programming languages: C, C#, C++, HTML, CSS, PHP, Java, JavaScript, Python, R, Perl, VBA   Requirements:  Programming languages: Java, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, HTML5,  Applications/Frameworks: Adobe XD, Microsoft Office Suite (required), Confluence, JIRA  Competencies/Knowledge Bases: UI and UX strategies, front end web development, Git versioning control  Technical (STEM) master’s degree ( preferred ); Bachelor’s degree in computer science or software engineering ( required )  Mid-level: 6+ years  Junior-level: 3+ years  Security clearance: Secret ( preferred )   The salary range for this position in Colorado is estimated to be $95,000 - $115,000. Final salary will be determined based on various factors.  About La Jolla Logic  La Jolla Logic  is an advanced technology and information system security solution firm headquartered in Southern California. Our professional staff has technical, programmatic and executive leadership experience spanning nearly 20 years supporting the US Department of Defense (DoD), academic institutions and the commercial sector. We are a Woman-Owned Small Business with a reputation for performance to the highest standard with a mission to pioneer innovative, high-quality specialty technology and engineering services.  As a provider of world-class service, quality work products, and with a focus on a customer-centered cooperative work approach, our staff specializes in technologies and services such as secure enterprise architectures, risk assessment and management, technical proposal and concept development services, machine learning technology, and compliance services (such as NIST 800-171 and CMMC).  We are a Woman-Owned Small Business (WOSB) and recipient of numerous awards, to include:  San Diego Business Journal (SDBJ) 2021 Women of Influence in Technology 2021  SDBJ 100 Fastest Growing Private Companies 2020  Union Tribune San Diego's Top Workplaces 2021  Best Places to Work (5 Years in a Row) 2016-2021  Inc 5000 Fastest Growing Companies 2020-2021   LJL has a competitive compensation package that includes:  Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage  401K Matching  Educational Reimbursement  Extensive PTO for Vacation and Sick Leave  Paid Holidays

The Opportunity      GutCheck has a portfolio of cutting-edge research products and we are taking it to the next level. We are looking for a  Data Scientist  to join our Research Science and Innovation team. In this role you will play an important part in GutCheck's innovation and product development processes by applying your skills in statistics, storytelling with data and data visualizations to create new market research products and help drive innovation. This position can be remote based.      About Us      At GutCheck, we believe the most innovative businesses in the world are the ones who have a deep, multi-dimensional understanding of people.      Our business was born from the belief that while consumer trends were moving faster than ever, market research simply wasn't keeping up. Where others forced tradeoffs, we saw opportunity. As the pioneers of agile market research, we deliver the expertise and rigor our clients demand with the speed and flexibility required for a new era.      Over the last decade, that pioneering spirit has led us to continually sharpen our approach, pushing the envelope on the insights we deliver to ignite bigger ideas grounded in empathy. Driven by a deeper understanding of human experiences, we unlock bold new opportunities for the innovators of the world with speed and confidence.      GutCheck Culture      The GutCheck team is...          Innovative and ambitious; willing to push the boundaries in search of "more"      Cultivating opportunities to stretch and grow our experience and perspective, encouraging our clients to think bigger in the process      Collaborative and team-oriented, fostering an environment where empathy is celebrated      Delighted with unexpected insights and discoveries      Authentically true to self while relating and forging connections with our customers and the people we study         We are driven to find future GutCheckers who thrive in an agile environment, who embody our GASI Values – that is, hire people who Give A S***. It takes exceptional talent to deliver our brand promise. Come join us!      The Role      Produce Innovative Research Science          Develop AI/NLP, machine learning and statistical models to identify and invent innovative metrics, use cases, or data products to fuel GutCheck's growth and value      Support GutCheck innovation by designing and conducting measurement experiments and/or evaluating vendor methodologies - and deliver the results on time.      Scan the environment for new ideas and tools and bring them forward         Embed Data & Analytic Tools          Support cross-functional efforts to develop databases and data feeds consistent with our product and data strategy.      Support the cross-functional building out of data modeling and predictive analytic techniques and tools that help us extract additional value from GutCheck or client data.      Collaborate cross-functionally to automate statistical algorithms and techniques and ensure appropriate quality and error flagging reports         Increase Client Confidence          Serve as a consultant on research design, analysis, use of data on client engagements of the highest value to GutCheck growth.      Support custom client requests with ML or statistical modeling, if needed      Explain methods and approaches in intuitive, non-technical terms to client or internal stakeholders         Must Haves          Typically, 4-5 years applying data science skills in the social or decision sciences      Experience in data wrangling and mining, predictive modeling, natural language processing, machine learning, and Bayesian and other algorithms      Strong statistical understanding      Demonstrated ability to use R, including to automate methods or processes      Basic familiarity with database systems, SQL, NOSQL, and working with APIs      Basic knowledge of general-purpose programming languages – Java, Python         Bonus Points          Strong visual and written storytelling skills and experience using them to convey insights to clients in a compelling way      Experience with agile or lean development processes      Experience in market research, consumer insights or adjacent areas         Benefits and Perks      At GutCheck we want to make sure our team is healthy, happy and rewarded. In an effort to do just that, we offer all of our regular full-timers the following benefits and perks.      Benefits are subject to change at the company's discretion at any time          Competitive Pay      Medical, Life, Dental and Vision Insurance      Equity      401k      Flex Funds      Continuous Education Funds      Generous Time Off Programs      Parental Leave      Volunteer days      Employee Assistance Program         Base Compensation      Base Compensation Range: $90,000 - $110,000 and discretionary bonus      For more information on the company and the GutCheck team, please go to  www.gutcheckit.com      This job description   is not   a complete list of our qualifications or   position roles.        GutCheck   is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, genetic information, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status.

Major League Baseball is looking for Full Stack Software Engineers that are passionate about building new technologies for the baseball industry. Launched in 2001 as the tech arm of Major League Baseball, MLBAM is now a leading authority in real-time sports data processing, distribution and analysis.  MLB's Technology team builds all of your favorite web and mobile applications for the game of baseball. Using cutting edge technology, our apps are consumed by fans, broadcasters, stadiums, and MLB teams.   The Opportunity: As a Full Stack Software Engineer, your primary responsibilities will be to write clean, concise, modular code in an agile environment, mentor developers and provide code reviews.   You'll also:   Lead and take ownership of critical projects and your own initiatives.  Work on a great technology stack including Java, Spring, SQL, Javascript, React, Scala, Akka, R and more.  Introduce the technologies you feel passionate about.  Collaborate with a team of extraordinary engineers and technologists.  Work alongside top data scientists on data analysis, machine vision and NLP.  Participate in the full lifecycle of software development (requirements gathering, designing, building, testing and maintenance).  Change the way baseball is consumed.  Receive amazing benefits - you get 100% employer-paid Medical, Dental and Vision.   You have:   2+ years of experience using front end technologies: JavaScript, React, HTML5, CSS3.  Experience using JVM languages (Java, Scala, Kotlin…).  Experienced building large and scalable applications.  An avid learner, independent with excellent problem-solving skills.  Passionate about mentoring peer developers, providing code reviews, etc.  Baseball fan.   Preferred, but not required:   Exposure to Google Cloud Platform or Amazon Web Services.  Familiar with messaging queues: ActiveMQ or RabbitMQ or similar  Experience with SQL databases  Understanding of big data concepts and knowledge of big data languages/tools such as Hadoop, Kylin, or Spark  Experience with 3D modeling and statistical analysis of 3D models   Why MLB?  Major League Baseball (MLB) is the most historic of the major professional sports leagues in the United States and Canada. Employees love working at MLB because of the culture of growth, teamwork, and professionalism. Employees who are most successful at MLB take initiative, know how to identify problems and provide solutions, and always put the Team first. For those ready to step up to the plate and join the Major Leagues, MLB takes the same approach as teams do with their players: empowering our "workforce athletes" to be at their best by engineering experiences that put employees in the best position to succeed. Major League Baseball is looking for candidates who are passionate about growing America's pastime to best serve its fans for decades to come.  MLB's vision is to be the global sport of choice for youth to play, fans of all backgrounds to enjoy and a desired destination for employment. With a belief that the journey to growth and greatness is ongoing, MLB gives employees the opportunity to continue learning and honing their skills with programs such as: tuition reimbursement; mentorship programs; lunch and learns; online course subscriptions; paid industry certifications; business resource groups; and more.  MLB provides its employees with exceptional medical, dental, and vision coverage. Premiums are 100% employer covered to help employees focus on being their best!  Are you ready to Step Up to the Plate? Apply below! All in-office and ballpark-based positions are subject to MLB's mandatory Covid-19 vaccine policy

Verily is an Alphabet company combining a data-driven, people-first approach to bring the promise of precision health to everyone, every day.       Our team combines expertise in healthcare, data science and technology to improve the health and well-being of our communities. We are developing the infrastructure and solutions to harness the profusion of health information for good. Our data-driven solutions span three primary areas: research, care and innovation. Programs include Project Baseline - our research initiative to increase participation and evidence generation in clinical research; Onduo - our personalized virtual care platform, which includes connected tools, lifestyle coaching and clinical support; and Debug - our effort to reduce the threat of mosquito-borne diseases by combining machine learning with sterile insect technique. We're also actively working to combat the spread of COVID-19 through new programs like Healthy at Work.             Description       The Sensors Infrastructure team (known internally as SensorSuite) aims to accelerate the transition to personalized care through the adoption of health sensors and wearables. The SensorSuite team provides microservices for device management and data collection to securely ingest and store time-series data from sensors in the field. We also provide tools for our Data Science and Product teams to activate these large datasets to produce digital biomarkers and other health insights.       As a Software Engineer on the SensorSuite team, you'll help build the tools and infrastructure to support hardware teams developing new sensors, product teams leveraging health-monitoring devices to deliver care, and data science efforts that extract insights from large datasets of time-series sensor data. You'll tackle problems with data consistency and availability, take on privacy and security issues, and build scalable infrastructure so that our partner teams can focus on what they do best.                  Responsibilities                    Contribute to a secure and scalable data platform that turns raw signals from devices into digital biomarkers and useful health information.         Ensure data consistency and availability for data types from many different sensors and devices.         Create tools and APIs that allow partner teams to integrate their devices and data types into the SensorSuite ecosystem.         Collaborate with Hardware Engineers to get their data into SensorSuite, Data Scientists to derive health insights from raw signals, and Software Engineers to surface the data and insights in Verily's products.                          Qualifications            Minimum qualifications:              Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.         Experience writing software in Java, Python, or Golang.         Strong verbal and written communication skills.        Preferred qualifications:              Passionate about providing reliable and empowering infrastructure.         Experience writing and maintaining large-scale data processing pipelines.               (Colorado Only) Minimum salary of $142,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.

The Company:      Invitae is dedicated to bringing comprehensive genetic information into mainstream medicine to improve healthcare for billions of people. Our team is driven to make a difference for the patients we serve. We are leading the transformation of the genetics industry by making genetic testing affordable and accessible for everyone to guide health decisions across all stages of life.             Position Summary:      The Bioinformatics Scientist III will join our Oncology R&D team designing bioinformatic pipelines to deliver results from next generation sequencing assays. This role will be responsible for prototype analysis pipelines,  in silico  experiments, data analysis, and the transfer of pipelines to production. This person will interface with assay development scientists, statisticians, software engineers, product managers, and other diverse functional groups. The position is expected to keep detailed records and communicate projects and data effectively to a diverse audience.             Responsibilities             Job performance will involve a variety of activities including but not limited to:          Develop novel algorithms which analyze next generation sequencing data to provide improved outcomes for cancer patients.      Where possible assemble data pipelines from existing tools to interpret next generation sequencing data.      Working alongside the assay development team to identify and design novel applications for our technologies, including Anchored Multiplex PCR (AMP) chemistry.      Exploratory data analysis and  in silico  experimentation to facilitate data-driven decisions.      Designing scalable, maintainable, and well-tested commercial grade algorithms and software for the automation and support of feasibility and analytical validation studies.      Presenting results internally and externally.      Mentoring less experienced teammates in career development and technical acumen.      Following company policies for producing software.      Reviewing, understanding and ensuring compliance with Invitae HIPAA security policies and procedures.      Safeguarding the privacy and security of protected health information and European Union personal data.      Processing and handling of European Union personal data only as directed by Invitae for purposes of personalized molecular pathology.                Qualifications                 M.S. or Ph.D. in bioinformatics, computer science or related field.      5+ years of professional bioinformatics experience (industry experience preferred).      Experience in creating robust machine learning/statistical models using biological data.      Proficiency with Python, Git and standard NGS bioinformatics tools.      Experience modifying existing Bioinformatics tools for a specific chemistry is a plus.      Understanding of PCR, NGS, cancer genetics, and population genetics.      Understanding of regulatory requirements for software development in medical devices is preferred.      Demonstrated scientific problem-solving skills.      Formal software development experience is a plus.      Proficiency in object-oriented programming and software testing is a plus.         #LI-REMOTE      In Colorado, our competitive compensation package includes a base salary starting from $123,760.00. In determining the final salary offered, we will evaluate a specific candidate's geographic location, education, skills, and experience.      At Invitae, we value diversity and provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Who is Recruiting from Scratch:                Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.                     About Our Client                   Our client is building an on-ramp to homeownership – one that's more flexible, more affordable, and an all-around better fit for today’s American family and it’s working.            Data Engineering Opportunities:       Our client’s mission to empower home ownership means that they not only buy thousands of homes, but that each of those home purchases must be optimized to fit their current customers’ budgets, and to allow our client the resources to bring more customers into the dream of home ownership.       Their engineering, analytic, and operations teams do amazing work to underwrite customers, generate competitive offers, thoroughly and thoughtfully inspect homes, and to support and service their customers in their new homes. And all of these teams rely on current, complete, diverse, and well-curated data to improve their efficiency and to gain a competitive advantage in our client’s targeted markets. Thus, quality and reliable data provide a key foundation for everything our client does.                    About the Role:       Their business is built upon programmatically making intelligent data-based decisions in every area of our business. They rely heavily on structured data to build financial and risk models, to understand their markets, and to improve their customer services. This requires a strong and very flexible infrastructure that ingests, stores, and retrieves live real estate and related data. In this role, you will help to build their ingestion and ETL pipelines, data lakes, and other key data services to support their engineering and operational divisions.                    You will be able to leverage your adaptability, creativity, and skill set to make homeownership more accessible and equitable. Our client has a small team that is still uncovering critical data sources and applications, so broad, flexible, and proactive thinking is key to their success. You’ll be expected to take ownership of your projects, to support your teammates on other projects, and work collectively to scale their platform to thousands of new applicants and multiple new markets. Almost every project will require cross functional collaboration across the entire home buying process. And you will have the opportunity to work alongside a fantastic team of engineers, product managers, data scientists, and field experts—all of whom are committed to our client's mission, and thirsty for your help in providing that data and tooling to support their passion.                    Responsibilities  :              Ingesting and curating large amounts of heterogeneous real estate and transactional data in batch and real time to create a high quality and accurate data-set.        Quantifying accuracy and uncertainty in our data.        Performing analysis to ensure our datasets are robust and reliable for machine learning        and business use cases.        Working comfortably with data processing technologies (e.g., SQL, Spark, Python,        storage & messaging solutions), with the ability to discern the right tool for the job.        Working to supplement our current data streams to further enrich or data-set (unstructured data such as images, new data providers, integrations, etc.).                         Work Experience             You have multiple years of software development experience        You have experience and an understanding of the entire stack (front-end to database)        You demonstrate a desire for readable, testable, and performant code        You have empathy for your peers and our customers        A deep understanding of data processing technologies such as SQL, Spark, Kafka, etc.        Experience with ETL scheduling technologies                             Benefits:               Competitive salary + equity       Full benefits (medical, dental, vision)       Compassionate and mission focused co-workers       The opportunity to transform the lives of our customers                        Base Salary Range:  $120,000 to $190,000

Our mission is to transform the way financial professionals deliver advice at scale and build collaborative relationships with their clients. At eMoney advisor, we are changing the rules in the wealth management industry through the infusion of cutting-edge technology and services.     For more than two decades, our software engineers have worked to develop products for financial professionals to transform the financial services industry as you know it today, to the dynamic and technology-forward industry of tomorrow. This includes bringing fresh ideas to legacy concepts and making sure that eMoney’s core values of collaboration, innovation, passion, integrity and of course fun are never compromised.     eMoney is a technology company and its engineers are its core. We are looking for the best and brightest software enthusiasts with a variety of technical skills who are ready to solve problems and challenge conventional thinking. People that love software design and our agile development methodology, whose views help to expand our product offerings in will thrive in our environment.     We are looking for a strong Cloud Data Architect to help us evolve our data architecture from single product to multi-product, and from traditional OLTP and analytics data stores to modern cloud data architecture. You will work together with product managers and owners, application development managers and tech leads, to define system architecture across multiple products, setting technology standards and strategy. This role will require a breadth of technology and communication skills to influence and lead the strategic direction.     As a Senior Advisory Data Architect, you will help shepherd the evolution of our technology stack and system architecture. You will lead solution architecture efforts, collaborating with development teams and stakeholders throughout the organization. You will use your broad experience and demonstrated sound judgement to define technology standards and practices that connect development teams with architecture strategy. You will provide vision for how the system architecture needs to evolve in order to support key business objectives, and you will plan the strategy to get there.     Job Responsibilities         Partner with development teams to build scalable, sustainable, maintainable and secure software.      Influence, communicate and lead technology and design decisions      Develop a deep understanding of the business context around the product and see the application not only as a developer, but also from the perspective of a user.      Coach other team members, sharing your knowledge and expertise. Collaborate with Tech Leads and other Architects to make decisions on adoption of technology standards, patterns, and practices that accelerate product delivery while aligning development activities to architecture vision.      Lead organization-wide architecture initiatives.      May lead multiple large initiatives in parallel.      Do research, deliver proof of concept experiments, write documentation, and collaborate across the organization to plan and deliver on key architectural initiatives.      Work closely with development teams on execution of strategic projects, participating in design discussions, ceremonies, development, testing, and deployment as needed.      Propose technologies and techniques that solve specific problems or that may provide business opportunity, based on experience, collaboration, and knowledge of industry trends.      Participate in system design reviews for key projects, propose solutions, and surface misalignment with strategy and standards.      Support development teams in various areas of the technology stack.      Participate in project scope and prioritization.      Passionately evangelize your work throughout the organization using various channels.      Mentor other Architects in technical expertise and in abilities to collaborate and influence.           Requirements         15+ years working in an architecture role      Experience working in a modern software development environment using practices such as continuous integration, continuous deployment, TDD, Agile practices such as Scrum, Kanban, XP.      Knowledge of cloud technologies, microservices and messaging, and queueing.      Experience in data security and PII protection      Experience transitioning from SQL datastores to noSQL with full HA characteristics      Experience defining data architecture in both on premise and cloud environments, and with defining the future state technology and transition activities to migrate data layer to cloud      Experience modeling data for enterprise services such as person      In depth knowledge of multiple development languages and technology such as: .NET, .NET Core, C#, Python, Java      Experience with AWS data storage, data engineering, data transport and query technologies such as DynamoDB, Aurora, Redshift, S3, EMR, Glue, Redshift, Athena      Strong expertise in data management and engineering technology including:            Data warehouse and data lake platforms        Data migration and transformation pipelines        Data lineage and governance        Data Analytics           Experience with integration with multiple internal and external systems      Knowledge of Machine Learning concepts and deployment a plus      A desire to continuously learn new technologies, approaches, and practices.        Skills         Strong written and verbal communication skills, ability to work with remote team members in virtual communication channels      Demonstrated ability to influence, communicate and lead technology and design decisions at the leadership level      Demonstrated abilities to communicate technology and product needs between product and engineering teams        The salary range for this position is $146,000 - $185,000; commensurate salary to be determined based on skills, professional background and expertise. This position is also eligible, pursuant to applicable eMoney policies, for the annual bonus program, retirement contributions, health insurance, sick leave, parental leave and paid time off.

Date Posted:  March 1, 2022        Job ID:  COS-CYB-031        City/State:  Colorado Springs, CO or Denver, CO        Schedule:  Full-Time        Salary Range:  $102,700 – $193,600, depending on experience.        About Us:  Caliola is a woman-owned small business that is improving and protecting our Nation's way of life through secure communications. This is an opportunity to join a dedicated, rapidly-growing, and inclusive team. Our mission is to provide technical solutions and services for secure and resilient communications. Our core values are:      I3 for C3 – Innovation, Insight, and Integrity for Command, Control, and Communications      Caliola offers a flexible, collaborative, and open culture that is unique in the defense industry. We offer generous benefits, including subsidized health insurance and 401(k) matching, and a scalable, competitive pay structure.      Joining Caliola will give you the opportunity to learn from experienced technical leaders in the field, as well as defense domain experts with decades of knowledge and broad access. Our success depends on not just knowing how to solve today's problems, but on anticipating the problems that our customers will need solved tomorrow.        Position Description:  Since our founding in July 2019, we have developed a broad portfolio of technology across three product verticals. Our Planning Products Team is developing tools that solve logistics and communications planning problems using machine learning, artificial intelligence, and combinatorial optimization. Our OverKey® Products team is developing cybersecurity solutions for US Space Force and multiple industrial applications. Our Waveform & Signal Processing Products Team is developing communications and positioning solutions that are more resilient, secure, and cost-effective to meet the needs of our customers in defense and beyond.      We are looking for experienced software engineers to join our rapidly-growing team. As a Software Architect, you will lead the architectural definition, design, and development of software-based products that enable secure and assured communications. We are looking for teammates that share a passion for the creative application and development of wireless technologies to bring information more securely to warfighters and first responders.        Technical Responsibilities:          Create architectural specifications and address problems of systems integration.     Perform research on potential project and product feasibility.     Train and oversee the activities of a team of C++, Python, and full-stack software engineers.     Define and enforce technical standards – e.g., coding standards, tools, and platforms.       What We Require:          8+ years of experience in software development.     Deep understanding of software design patterns and architectural styles.     Strong experience with both front-end and back-end technologies.     Experience in two or more of our core languages (C++, Python, and JavaScript).     This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance, which is issued by the U.S. Government. Security clearances may only be granted to U.S. citizens. In addition, applicants who accept a conditional offer of employment may be subject to government security investigation(s) and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.       What We Value:          BS or MS in Computer Science (CS), Electrical Engineering (EE), Math, Physics, or related discipline.     Experience with DevSecOps Software Factories – e.g., Platform One.     Active security clearance.     Software Architect        Expression of Interest:  By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities at Caliola Engineering. Should a match be identified between your skillset and Caliola's requirements for this or a future opening, you may be contacted.        Flexible Work Schedule:  This position can be in-person or a remote position at your home office with frequent reporting requirements to Caliola's headquarters office in Colorado Springs, CO.        Relocation Available:  Relocation is available to Colorado Springs, CO.      At Caliola, we believe that true innovation can only occur when teammates bring their authentic selves to collaborate in a supportive, encouraging environment. We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age, or any other federally protected class.

About SparkFun Since 2003, SparkFun has been helping turn ideas into reality – whether you’re creating a smart weather station, exploring the frontier of machine learning, building a robot for school or prototyping your first (or tenth) product. We are an equal opportunity employer that values a diverse workforce and an inclusive culture. SparkFun offers an abundance of opportunities to learn new skills from other Funions, in addition to many other benefits and perks.   SparkFun's Next IT Systems Administrator   SparkFun is looking to add an IT Systems Administrator to our IT team, to help in the design, maintenance, and operation of our systems infrastructure. This position focused on network operations and Linux administration, supporting our IT infrastructure at our headquarters building, as well as our internal application infrastructure on AWS.   Focusing on success, this position helps design, select and deploy industry standard systems and software that are resilient, end-user friendly and required minimal long-term maintenance.   The right candidate collaborative works with fellow team members and internal customers to find solutions to IT infrastructure needs. As issues arise, the candidate works cooperatively to identify and correct the issue, ensuring progress is communicated to the team.   This position is  not  a Windows Administrator role, but knowledge of Windows is a plus.   Essential Job Functions      Help in the design, deploy, and maintain the infrastructure for SparkFun’s internal and external cloud systems.    Provide ongoing monitoring and response for systems using monitoring and alerting tools.    Perform system troubleshooting efforts: identify issues, develop corrective actions, and deploy fixes.    Perform Linux administration tasks    Participates in an on-call rotation with other team members    Support backup and disaster recovery capabilities.    Support systems security measures and deployments     Required   Qualifications        Proficiency administering Linux-based systems    Experience in network design and topology, administration, and routing    Experience and knowledge of cloud-based infrastructures. Knowledge of AWS a plus    Experience with enterprise configuration management software    Experience in administrating common enterprise systems, including relational databases, caching systems and NoSQL data stores.    Experience in the deployment and operation of common system services (i.e. DHCP, DNS, LDAP, SNMP…etc).    3+ years of systems development and operation experience    A “Team First” attitude, putting team needs ahead of individual tasks    Excellent communication and collaboration skills     Preferred   Qualifications        Proficiency with scripting tools and languages (sh/bash, Python, Perl)    Experience with VPN deployments and management    Experience with enterprise Wi-Fi deployments     SparkFun Benefits & Perks SparkFun Electronics offers its employees a comprehensive benefits package, in addition to several perks. In regards to benefits, we offer medical, dental, and vision. And, we offer a 401k match, disability, life insurance, parental leave, and a flexible leave policy.   SparkFun offers many perks, including but not limited to a dog-friendly workplace, professional development opportunities, an on-site fitness center, lunch and learns, and internal classes to learn from fellow Funions! Flexible schedules are also available. Your Job           As a member of the     AI Ethics  team at Indeed, you’ll work within the     Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG)  organization and across the business to build tools, systems, and processes that advance responsible and inclusive AI. Your work will directly contribute to Indeed’s mission of helping all people get jobs by reducing bias and increasing fairness in our algorithmic systems. You will have the opportunity to work with machine learning and artificial intelligence systems of widely varying scope and complexity and your work will directly impact the development of more inclusive products. We are a multi-disciplinary team that sits at the intersection of applied research and technical execution with high visibility, high impact, and enthusiastic support.              The     Staff Product Scientist  will help define and lead the way algorithmic responsibility and ethical data practices are operationalized throughout the company. You will partner with teams across the business to drive how Indeed measures, audits, and tracks the fairness of algorithms across product teams. You will translate abstract calls into practical strategies and rigorous methods, empowering teams to assess the algorithmic impact of their products on fairness in the labor market, and help guide the work of others in doing so. You will provide guidance and partner with colleagues in legal, privacy, product, engineering, and other functions to devise scalable solutions to monitoring and increasing fairness in Indeed’s algorithmic systems. Mentorship is a key component of this role, as we are a team that is dedicated to continuous learning and improvement. This is a rapidly moving domain, with new legislation, regulation, and innovation emerging constantly.           Additionally, you will assist in the planning and execution towards progress of Indeed’s transformative ESG goals, including defining measurement strategies, intervention          Who You Are        Responsibilities         Research and develop methods that measure inequities in datasets, models, or products      Design, implement, and systematize statistically rigorous reviews to evaluate and address potential sources of bias      Partner closely with product teams, security, privacy, legal, and other stakeholders to define and implement ethical data practices      Translate complex, ambiguous questions into concrete analysis and action and assist colleagues in doing the same      Communicate findings to diverse technical and non-technical stakeholders with differing perspectives and needs, including senior leadership      Mentor colleagues in best practices, collaboration, and appropriate statistical methods      Assist in build-vs-buy decisions with product management and leadership      Partner with colleagues in ESG on meeting transformative ESG goals        Requirements         7+ years of professional industry experience in product analytics/data analysis      Experience coding in Python, R or another statistical programming language      Strong communication and collaboration skills      Ability to write and present results to both technical and non-technical audiences as well as providing input and editing of others’ work      Driven to proactively help their teammates and Indeed’s products and provide mentorship to less experienced colleagues      Experience designing and leading complex projects - including definition, measurement, partnership with product management, goal-setting, and work tracking        We get excited about candidates who:            Are passionate about diversity and inclusion in hiring      Ph.D. or M.S. in a quantitative social science (Economics, Psychology, Sociology, Political Science) OR in a quantitative field (Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Machine Learning, Computer Science)           Who we are           As Indeed continues to grow, our Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) group ensures that society will also benefit across a broad range of disciplines - Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging (DI&B), Accessibility, Social Impact, Environmental Sustainability, Governance, and AI Ethics. We’re changing the way the world hires, for good. Apply today and #BelongAtIndeed          Our Mission           As the world’s number 1 job site*, our mission is to help people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers. Company.  What we are building:  Skupos drives revenue growth across all segments of the convenience retail industry through technology that connects both retailers and brands to their shoppers. With a focus on independent stores and small chains which make up nearly 80% of the market, the Skupos platform enables both retailers and brands to compete through better understanding and serving their customers. Founded in 2016, a growing network of 14,000+ customers across all 50 states rely on Skupos to boost sales volume and increase their customer base. Role.  An overview of the opportunity:  At Skupos, data is everything. Our data integrates the forgotten, fragmented world of mom-and-pop corner with the glitzy, gigantic world of CPG conglomerates.  With tens of millions daily transactions, Skupos is looking for a data engineer to wrangle and tame our data flows, expand and optimize our data and data pipeline architecture.   Team.  The team and our people:  This role will be part of the Data Platform team, the core functional team building our data products. The team works closely with the Data Infrastructure, Product and BI teams.   Responsibilities.  Your responsibilities will include:   Building and maintaining the data and reporting layers for customer facing products.  Collaborate closely with Data Infrastructure and Analytics teams to build complex data pipelines to deliver CICD complete deployment, move data cross - platforms including real time systems.  Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.  Work with the Data Infrastructure team to build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and AWS 'big data' technologies.  Create data tools, analytical datasets for Data Analytics and Machine Learning teams that assist them in building and optimizing our product  Maintain and deliver continuous improvement of core projects through automation and process enhancement  Work with all data teams and consumers to strive for greater functionality in our data systems  Partner with engineers, product managers, and data scientists to breakdown data requirements, analyze source data sets, address data quality issues and effectively build and automate ETL pipelines at scale.  Partner with ML engineers, data infrastructure team to define and own Data engineering tools, products and processes in place and define/set SLAs for each.  Have deep understanding of existing data integration challenges and solutions with optimal ETL solutions and querying techniques   Experience and Skills.  Candidates should have:   Bachelor's degree or equivalent, ideally in a technical or quantitative field (advanced degree is a plus).  4-6+ years of experience working with SQL  Advanced with proficiency with Python, Java, or Scala in a production environment  1-3 years of experience building and optimizing large-scale data pipelines, architectures and data sets.  Recent experience (2+ years) with a modern data warehouse (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift, Pentaho)  Experience with data warehousing architecture and understanding of data modeling concepts and best practices (e.g., normalization/denormalization).  Production experience with Spark  Familiarity with stream-processing platforms and message-queues (e.g. Flink, Hadoop, Kafka) is a plus   Salary is based on experience and location.  Salary range based on Denver Market: $140,000 - $155,000. Benefits.  What we offer:   Competitive salary  Medical, dental, and vision insurance  401(k) retirement savings plan  Discretionary time off (DTO)  Wellness stipend  And more!   A Note on Covid...  We are fortunate to continue to grow during this unfortunate time. Our top priority is to ensure the health and safety of both our current and future Skupeeps.  As of July, our physical office spaces have reopened on a voluntary basis. Our Skuad members are allowed onsite if they are fully vaccinated (2 weeks past final vaccine dose). That being said, we will continue to manage our interview process virtually, don't be surprised if children or pets make an appearance.  We deeply care about you as our candidate, so let the People Team know if there's anything we can do to make your interview process go more smoothly - we are in your corner!

Who is Recruiting from Scratch:      Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more. If you are a fit, the team will reach out to you about this role or any others that may be a fit for our clients.                          About Our Client                         Our client is the first sleep fitness company. They design products at the forefront of sleep innovation. Our client's mission is to make people’s sleep count for more, using innovative technology, detailed design, and proven science and data to personalize and improve each night for everybody—changing the way people sleep forever and for the better.                     Our client wants to fuel human potential through optimal sleep. In 2019, they launched our temperature-regulated smart bed, The Pod. They currently power the sleep of over 60,000 people every night. They have partnered with Barry’s as their Official Sleep Fitness Partner. Our client actively collaborates with Justin Medeiros, 2021 Crossfit Champion and Red Gerard, U.S. Snowboarding Olympic Gold-Medalist. GQ awarded our client the Fitness Reward in 2021, along with receiving the Men’s Health Sleep Award that same year. Our client is backed by leading Silicon Valley investors and recognized as one of the Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies In Consumer Electronics.                                    Our client is looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer to join their engineering team. The ideal candidate has practical experience with modern ML frameworks, is able to rapidly prototype ideas from the latest research, and has an extensive track record of shipping cutting-edge and impactful ML products. What you'll need to succeed                                      5+ years of software engineering experience                  - High standards for code quality-i.e. you apply principles of clean code and prioritize testing.                                   4+ of experience working in Python                                   Strong experience with Pytorch (or an equivalent deep learning framework), and a general ML toolkit: e.g. numpy, pandas, sklearn, xgboost, H20, etc.                                   Experience creating low latency production ML systems.                                   Masters Degree or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, or 4+ years functioning as a machine learning engineer.                                              Nice to haves:                                      Experience building casual models.                                   Experience conducting A/B tests / randomized trials.                                                Why you’ll love our client                                  They are a tight-knit, passionate team that’s working to improve people’s lives by improving the way they sleep                               Leadership is committed to employees’ wellness and career development                               You’ll get a better night sleep every night                               Flexible, generous PTO                               100% employer contribution for medical/dental/vision insurance                                               Base Salary Range:  150K-190K

job_title: Data Scientist - Utility Reliability (Jr & Sr) - REMOTE
job_Description: Are you a data scientist looking to join an industry-leading team?   E Source develops groundbreaking data science applications that change the way utilities understand and manage their networks. We tackle challenging projects like forecasting the impact of severe weather on utility networks and optimizing vegetation removal strategies. To conduct these projects, we leverage a combination of machine-learning models, inference-based statistics, and remote-sensing applications. Each project or product is collaboratively developed in-house by a data science team of all experience levels and professional backgrounds. Ultimately, our work helps utilities enhance their electric reliability and prepare to adopt and deploy cutting-edge green energy technology.   * Required qualifications: *      BS, MS, or PhD in a numerical analysis–related field of study    Experience conducting data science projects in a professional or educational setting    Proficiency and demonstrated experience in all phases of the data science life cycle working with real-world data—data compilation, data exploration, feature selection and engineering, training and testing of models, and communication of results    Proficiency in R or Python     * Preferred qualifications: *      Work experience collaborating as part of a data science team    Domain expertise in remote-sensing processing and geospatial analytics    Domain expertise in meteorology or using remotely sensed weather observations    Domain expertise in the utilities (electric, gas, or water) space     * A little about E Source*   Since 1986, E Source has focused on partnering with utilities to help their customers save electricity. That novel approach defined the art of electric end-use efficiency—better known as energy efficiency. We’ve expanded that concept to include a broader perspective of sustainability for utilities that deliver electricity, natural gas, and water.   We work to enhance relationships with the people utilities serve, achieve the next generation of savings, and lead the carbon-reduction effort. We help utilities think differently, make data useful, and learn from the best strategies across the industry. Our people, our insights, and our network help our clients and give them the assurance that the programs they implement are the most effective.   * Benefits*   * We offer excellent insurance packages, including medical, dental, and vision plans; company-paid life insurance; company-paid long- and short-term disability insurance; and medical and dependent-care flexible spending plans.      We provide a flexible time off (FTO) program; E Source employees can take as many paid days off per year as they need, with manager approval, while fulfilling their work obligations and ensuring proper coverage of their responsibilities.    We offer flexible schedules, flexible work locations, and a paid parental leave benefit.    We provide a 401(k) plan with a 3% employer match.     The budgeted salary for this position is  $75,000 to $100,000 + annual bonus (junior) or $100,000 to $130,000 + annual bonus (senior).  Actual pay will be adjusted based on experience.   This person can work remote, a hybrid schedule, or from one of our physical office locations.   Applicants must be authorized to work for any employer in the US. We’re unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of employment visas at this time.   All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.   Job Type: Full-time   Pay: $75,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

job_title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer, Machine Learning Platform (Kubernetes)
job_Description: SoundHound Inc. builds voice AI products that make it easier for people to engage with the world around them. We do this by creating custom voice assistants that make it possible for companies to extend their brand in new and meaningful ways. Today, our customized voice AI solutions allow people to talk to phones, cars, smart speakers, mobile apps, coffee machines, and every other part of the emerging 'voice-first' world.      To provide the fastest and most accurate voice assistants on the market, we leverage many deep learning models. As such, we have built a GPU-based Machine Learning platform to facilitate ML training and inference. We are looking for a motivated engineer with experience in distributed systems and Machine Learning workflows to expand and manage the ML platform.      As a member of our Language Modeling team, you have an opportunity to bring many state-of-the-art NLP models to production. We look forward to connecting with you if you're drawn to this type of work.      In this role you will:         Expand and manage the GPU-based Machine Learning platform      Develop tools to scale ML training and inference      Build tools and infrastructure that will benefit all ML teams      Productionize ML models        We would love to hear from you if:         You graduated with a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science      You have spent at least two years working with kubernetes      You have experience building and managing distributed systems      You are knowledgeable in GPU-based ML model training and inference      You have experience with DevOps tools such as ansible or terraform      You are comfortable working in a Unix environment and using the applicable tools         We'd be especially excited if you have scaled out an ML deployment or have experience with ML toolkits like kubeflow, TFX, or MLFlow. Also, be sure to let us know if you have scaled GPU-based ML training across multiple nodes.         Here at SoundHound, diversity, equity, and inclusion are key to who we are as a company. With a mission to build Voice AI for the world, creating a team with global perspectives is critical to our success.      We care deeply about fostering an environment where everyone is supported and can do their best work. SoundHound will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations to participate in the interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive other employment benefits.      The estimated range of base pay for this position in Colorado is $136,000-$166,000 USD/year, however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. A total RSU grant amount will be provided as a component of the total compensation package for this role, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits dependent on the position offered. A sign on bonus may be provided as a component of total compensation. This information is provided per the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act. Base pay information is based on market location.      Employees enjoy comprehensive health care, paid time off, discounted fitness classes, and flexible working hours. Learn more about our philosophy, benefits, and culture at https://soundhound.com/careers/.      To view our job applicant privacy policy, please visit https://static.soundhound.com/corpus/ta/applicantprivacynotice.html.      Come join our growing team and bring your unique voice to our mission!

About You  The Vice President, Data and Analytics has both hands-on/tactical responsibilities and significant strategic responsibilities for continually evolving the analytic capabilities of the entire Noodles & Company organization. This role has primary responsibility for the analysis, design, development, testing and execution of technology supporting business intelligence/analytic capabilities and data integrations. This role leads and directly contributes to the efforts of a team in designing, developing, and maintaining the data structures that integrate business applications and enable best-in-class analytics. Besides leading a team within the IT Department, this role is expected to facilitate and coordinate analytic endeavors across multiple departments (Finance, HR, Marketing, etc.). Fostering collaboration and ensuring predictable, continued progress are primary expectations of the VP-Data and Analytics.     About Noodles     At Noodles & Company, our mission is to always nourish and inspire every team member, guest and community we serve. We accomplish this by living our values of We Care, We Show Pride, We are Passionate, and We Love Life! We provide our team members with opportunities to learn culinary skills working with fresh food and the art of personal connection with our guests. Come join our amazing team, make new friends, develop your career and have fun!     We are proud to be recognized on  Forbes’ Best Employers for Diversity 2021  and  Forbes’ Best Employers for Women 2021  lists and are committed to creating an inclusive environment where Noodlers can bring their full self to work.     Benefits   Careers at Noodles are served with a side of:         Pay range: $165,000-$190,000      Noodles Restricted Stock Unit (RSU) incentive      Eligible for annual performance bonus      Flexible paid time off      Medical, dental and vision insurance      401(k) and stock purchase discounts      Paid maternity and paternity leaves, adoption and surrogacy benefits      Discounts through our gift card program      Scholarship opportunities      Learn more about our benefits: noodles.com/careers/perks/        Your Day in the Life         Partner both within IT and across the organization to develop, communicate, and own the execution of a unified strategy for analytic excellence including advanced analytics, predictive modeling, business reporting, enterprise data governance strategy, data security, and data integration.      Develop and execute the approaches to enable the analysis of large data sources, development of predictive models and allow reliable reporting and analysis by analysts throughout the organization.      Ensure that the organization is evaluating emerging/disruptive technologies and processes for data, data services, data warehousing, data analytics and cloud solutions.      Lead the migration from a primarily on-premises data infrastructure to the cloud.      Develop complex queries and stored procedures for reporting, analysis and to meet ad-hoc needs.      Optimize transactional processing (e.g. payroll) and system integrations (e.g. Dynamics SL, Workday, TalentReef, Lucernex) to preserve IT capacity for initiatives – especially analytic advancements.      Maintain a data ecosystem that incorporates agile development and testing capabilities necessary to support frequent updates while ensuring stability and accuracy.      Coach and develop the Information Systems Team to contribute to overall IT Department initiatives and minimize areas where only one team member has knowledge.      Maintain internal processes, documentation, and configurations in support of relevant regulations/compliance needs and aligned with all solution provider best practices (especially PCI & SOX).      Ensure proper documentation of all business requirements, projects, and solution components.      Share in the off-hours support of the data ecosystem and business critical reporting.      Provide technical and product knowledge to other members of the IT Department – serving as the escalation point for any IT Support (tier 1) needs beyond the technical expectations of this team.      Assist during the budgeting and planning process and operate within acceptable budgetary parameters.        What You Bring to the Team         Experience with current (and evolving) big data and cloud-based data solutions (e.g. Snowflake, BigQuery, Power BI, Redshift, Azure Synapse).      Strong data fundamentals: ETL, SQL, data manipulation, data migration, database tuning and admin.      Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, Scala, etc) to draw insights from large data sets.      Familiarity with machine learning (supervised and unsupervised).      Demonstrated ability to foster collaboration across multiple departments and disciplines.      Experience with Point-of-Sale (POS) data for internal reporting as well as data from other disparate sources.      Experience with both tabular and MDX SSAS cubes.      Strong interpersonal and communication skills, including written, verbal and active listening skills.      Ability to work in a team-orientated, collaborative environment on projects and troubleshooting.      Bachelor's Degree in computer science, data science, or equivalent discipline.      15+ years in data and analytics in a cross-functional organization.      Experience migrating a data platform from on-prem to cloud.      Experience with dev ops and agile methodologies.        Noodles is an  Equal Opportunity Employer . Our goal is to be an inclusive and diverse team that is representative of the communities and guests we serve.     noodles.com/careers         Brand: Noodles & Company     Address: 520 Zang Street Ste D Broomfield, CO - 80021     Property Description: 100 - Central Support Office     Property Number: 100

job_title: Tax Software & Systems Implementation Senior Associate
job_Description: The Innovation Team is at the core of innovation and emerging technology development, discovery, deployment and support activity. Our team is leading the effort to digitally enable our business. Our mission is to develop disruptive & innovative technologies and products that drive the evolution of how we deliver our services now and in the future. The key technology domains we are currently focused on include business process automation, data curation, industrialized analytics, machine learning & AI and scalable delivery platform. A career in our Tax Reporting and Strategy practice, within Innovation services, will provide you with the opportunity to help our clients’ tax departments redesign, redefine, and redeploy tax to be a strategic asset across the enterprise. You’ll focus on assisting clients incorporate increased automation in the tax reporting process, increase analytic capabilities through data integration, and create solid internal controls that will enable the Tax function to deliver better quality output and contribute more strategically to organisational decision making. Our team helps our clients expand the tax role to include research, analytics, and technologies to improve how their organisation collaborates and performs. You’ll focus on enhancing the tax reporting process by incorporating increased automation, integrating quality data, developing analytic capabilities, and utilising technology to deliver better quality output in less time. To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose-led and values-driven leader at every level. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future. As a Senior Associate, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to: Use feedback and reflection to develop self awareness, personal strengths and address development areas. Delegate to others to provide stretch opportunities, coaching them to deliver results. Demonstrate critical thinking and the ability to bring order to unstructured problems. Use a broad range of tools and techniques to extract insights from current industry or sector trends. Review your work and that of others for quality, accuracy and relevance. Know how and when to use tools available for a given situation and can explain the reasons for this choice. Seek and embrace opportunities which give exposure to different situations, environments and perspectives. Use straightforward communication, in a structured way, when influencing and connecting with others. Able to read situations and modify behavior to build quality relationships. Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct. Additional Responsibilities : Our Tax Reporting and Strategy (TRS) practice teams with organizations to design and execute industry leading tax functions, focusing on practical approaches to data, processes, technology and people. You’ll see tax from a new angle so you can redesign and redefine the Tax Department as a strategic asset across the enterprise. Custom Orgs :   Global LoS : Tax   Job Requirements and Preferences :   Basic Qualifications :   Minimum Degree Required : Bachelor Degree   Minimum Years of Experience : 2 year(s)   Preferred Qualifications :   Degree Preferred : Master Degree   Preferred Fields of Study : Business Studies, Information Technology, Information Technology & Accounting, Management Information Systems   Certification(s) Preferred : Possess at least one of the following: CPA Admission to the Bar Enrolled Agent Professional Certification in Project Management (PMP) Six Sigma Black Belt/Lean Black Belt/Master Black Belt Certified Business Intelligence Professional (CBIP) SAP Certified Professional Oracle Certified Professional PhD - Computer Science/Information Science or STEM Equivalent Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE) Microsoft Certified Solutions Developer (MCSD) Certified Software Quality Analyst (CSQA) Certified Software Tester (CSTE) UX Certificate - Nielsen Norman Group Certified Analytics Professional (CAP) or equivalent institutional Data Science Program Certified Secure Software Lifecycle Professional (CSSLP) Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) Preferred Knowledge/Skills : Demonstrates thorough abilities and/or a proven record of success in general tax principles and regulations, including the application of FAS 109, FAS 109 software, Beta Management, Organization Design, Process Improvement, Controls, and Risk Management to large corporate tax functions, including: Monitoring and analyzing legislative and regulatory tax developments; Analyzing the economic impact of tax legislation and federal budget proposals and determining technology needs to support tax function effectiveness; Building, maintaining, and utilizing networks of client relationships; Managing resource requirements, project workflow, budgets, billing and collections; and, Preparing and/or coordinating complex written and verbal materials. Demonstrates thorough knowledge and/or proven record of success in automation & digitization in a professional services environment including but not limited to: Utilizing data ingestion technologies (Alteryx, Azure Data Factory, Trifacta, SSIS, etc.); and, Data visualization/analytics tools (Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik, etc.); Utilizing digitization tools to reduce hours and optimize engagements; Innovating through new and existing technologies, along with experimenting with digitization solutions; Working with large, complex data sets to build models and leverage data visualization tools to provide insights to clients; Participating in tax technology implementations, including selection of software packages, assessments of processes and data flows, tax systems implementation and configuration and digital tax transformation; Completing tax organizational design, process improvement, controls, risk management, tax strategy and implementation of software products; and, Understanding tax-related data analytics. Demonstrates thorough knowledge and/or a proven record of success in the following areas: Utilizing communication, facilitation, and influencing skills in all aspects of assigned project areas; Balancing strategic thinking with pragmatism; Incorporating analytical and logical skills coupled with creative and technical problem-solving skills in day to day assigned project areas; Being action oriented and organized with a focus on conflict resolution, consensus building and negotiation; and, Leading teams and motivating members, creating an atmosphere of trust, leveraging diverse views, coaching staff and encouraging improvement and innovation.
